title: Some Republicans want more details on McConnell's health after another freeze-up
description: Some Republicans are raising concerns that Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell hasn't been transparent enough about his health following a second freeze-up.

title: Hurricane Idalia left communities digging out after causing widespread flooding and destruction
description: CEDAR KEY, Fla. — It was the hottest rental cottage at the Faraway Inn because it was right on the Gulf of Mexico and the sunsets were spectacular.

title: Mitch McConnell is 'medically clear' to continue work, U.S. Capitol doctor says
description: A day after Sen. Mitch McConnell appeared to freeze at a public event, the attending physician for the U.S. Capitol cleared him to work.

title: Utah family YouTuber arrested on abuse charges after malnourished child in duct tape found
description: Ruby Franke, the Utah mom behind the now-defunct family YouTube channel 8 Passengers, was arrested Wednesday on child abuse charges after a malnourished child with open wounds and duct tape on their extremities was found, officials announced.

title: Pro-Ron DeSantis super PAC ends door-knocking in Nevada and Super Tuesday states
description: Never Back Down, the super PAC backing Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis, terminated its door-knocking contracts in Nevada and Super Tuesday states.

title: Hurricane Idalia rebuilding may be hampered by Florida immigration law, workers say
description: Florida Latino immigrant workers said the state needed them to clean up after Hurricane Idalia though Gov. DeSantis tried to "push" them out with his new immigration law.

title: Overdose deaths from counterfeit pills are rising, especially among younger adults
description: Counterfeit pills have been linked to an increasing number of overdose deaths in recent years. Fake pills like oxycodone and Xanax can be laced with fentanyl.

title: Proud Boy Joe Biggs receives 17 years in Jan. 6 seditious conspiracy case
description: Joseph Biggs, a Proud Boys leader convicted of seditious conspiracy in connection with the Jan. 6 attack, will be sentenced Thursday.

title: Trump pleads not guilty in Georgia election interference case
description: Former President Donald Trump has entered a not guilty plea in the Georgia election interference case.

title: Visual artists fight back against AI companies for repurposing their work
description: A lawsuit alleges that AI image-generators violate the rights of millions of artists by ingesting huge troves of digital images and then producing derivative works that compete against the originals.

title: Justice Clarence Thomas discloses trips paid for by billionaire Harlan Crow
description: Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas has disclosed trips that were paid for by his friend, billionaire Harlan Crow, in his in his annual financial disclosure report.

title: Car with giant bull named Howdy Doody crammed into passenger seat pulled over by Nebraska police
description: A man driving a full-sized bull named Howdy Doody in his car was pulled over by police in Nebraska on Wednesday after a stunned onlooker reported the odd sight, authorities said.

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene says Mitch McConnell is 'not fit for office' after he appeared to freeze up for the second time
description: Marjorie Taylor Greene said McConnell is 'not fit for office' after he appeared to freeze up for the second time.

title: Why figuring out your tech personality can improve how you use it
description: Guru? Tech-phobic? Cyber-saver? USA Today’s Jennifer Jolly explains why figuring out your tech personality can help improve how you use it.

title: Idalia impacts coastal communities in North Carolina with flooding and strong winds
description: NBC News' Julia Ainsley reports from Morehead City, N.C., where Tropical Storm Idalia continues to bring rain and strong winds. A tornado warning has been issued for coastal communities.

title: Idalia brings fifth-highest tide ever recorded in Charleston
description: NBC News' Wendy Woolfolk reports from Charleston, S.C., after Idalia rolled through the state as a powerful tropical storm and brought strong winds, heavy rain, flooding and fifth-highest tide on record.

title: Idalia still packs destructive powers over parts of the Carolinas
description: NBC News' meteorologist Michelle Grossman forecasts flooding and destructive winds as Idalia heads east.

title: Watch: Strong wind gust flips car as Idalia moves into South Carolina
description: Video captured the moment a strong wind gust flipped a car in Goose Creek, South Carolina, injuring at least two people as Tropical Storm Idalia moved across the state. NBC News' Kathy Park reports on the latest.

title: Thousands still without power in Florida as South Carolina faces flooding
description: Thousands still without power in Florida as South Carolina faces flooding

title: Satellite images capture Hurricane Idalia's flooding in Florida's Big Bend
description: Satellite images illustrate the damage in Florida’s Big Bend where Hurricane Idalia made landfall.
